So long as such confusion exists, it is painfully
clear, we need to do a great deal of work in
the program development area. We must help those
talented and dedicated people zero in on the true
target, the poverty population in each state in the
country. We must help them understand the danger
of getting involved in situations which are separate
and apart from the actual conditions of poverty,
thereby becoming estranged from that population.
We must help them understand the need to be aware
of the dangers inherent in creating "arbitrary"
materials, and research exercises, and then
superimposing those structures onto the poverty
populations.
Most important of all, we must become intensely
sensitive to the dangers which exist in "making
promises" to the poverty population, promises that
are almost impossible to keep with things as they
are.
